Hi all... on the Senjuin from the fittings museum, there is a short
sayagaki which is mirrored on the tsunagi for the fittings.

Here's a picture:

http://www.nihonto.ca/senjuin/koshirae/ss/2.jpg

The last three characters read Senjuin pretty clearly.

The first two I read as "Origami???"

I'm not 100% confident because it's not making sense to me, unless it's
intended as a name? I dunno. Can anyone verify my translation and/or
provide a guess as to the meaning?

Thanks,

- darcy
